channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jerome Powell says it’s ‘different this time’—and Americans and their mortgage rates are a key reason why
item.description: But the Fed chair "wouldn't call it hot," saying the wholesale inflation report was "sort of mixed."

item.title: GameStop, AMC attracting a fraction of retail trader interest seen during 2021's meme mania
item.description: Mom-and-pop traders snapped up shares after the man credited with starting the meme stock mania resurfaced online, though at a lesser extent than seen in 2021.

item.title: Florida’s migrant farming community jolted by bus crash that kills 8, injures dozens more
item.description: Florida farms employ more H-2A workers than any other state, about 50,000 a year, according to the Florida Fruit & Vegetable Association.

item.title: Top bond fund manager Ford O'Neil of Fidelity reveals his 'secret sauce' to generate outperformance
item.description: O'Neil was recently nominated for Morningstar's 2024 outstanding portfolio manager award for investing excellence.

item.title: Rich Gen Xers are outpacing baby boomers in buying vacation homes
item.description: Interest in second homes hasn’t been this low in almost a decade, according to Redfin.

item.title: Walmart is laying off, relocating hundreds of corporate workers across the country. Read the memo
item.description: The move follows the closures of the company's health clinics and comes ahead of its earnings report on Thursday.

item.title: ‘Judge Judy’ sues National Enquirer parent company over misattributed quote in Menendez Brothers story
item.description: “When you fabricate stories about me in order to make money for yourselves with no regard for the truth or the reputation I've spent a lifetime cultivating, it's going to cost you."

item.title: Education Dept. announces highest interest rate on federal student loans in more than a decade
item.description: The U.S. Department of Education announced on Tuesday the interest rates on federal student loans for the 2024-2025 academic year.

item.title: Harvard protesters voluntarily withdraw after administration agrees to discuss endowment concerns
item.description: Harvard interim President Alan Garber agreed to pursue a meeting between protesters and university officials regarding the students’ questions.

item.title: Google rolls out its most powerful AI models as competition from OpenAI heats up
item.description: Google on Tuesday announced new additions to its AI model following a flashy rollout a day earlier from OpenAI.
